title: Mali: Lamamra chairs in Bamako meeting of international mediation group
text: The minister of Foreign Affairs and National Community Abroad, Ramtane Lamamra, chaired Saturday in Bamako, Mali, a meeting of the international mediation group on Mali, for the assessment of the implementation of the Agreement on Peace and Reconciliation in Mali, emanating from of the Algiers process.

In the light of the outcome of the sixth high-level session of the Monitoring Committee on the Implementation of the Agreement on Peace and Reconciliation in Mali, held the day before, the international mediation meeting was an opportunity for a frank and open discussion on the progress made and the challenges to take by the Malian parties in order to meet the objectives of the agreement during the ongoing transition phase.

Reiterating their continuous support to the Malian parties on the way to peace and reconciliation, the participants expressed appreciation for the new dynamics in the agreement's implementation process with the work resumption of the monitoring committee.

The participants have not failed to acknowledge Algeria's key role as both the leader of the international mediation and the chair of the monitoring committee, in addition to the fact that it is a neighbouring country with a strong commitment to make a success of the peace process reconciliation process in Mali.
